com.esri.mo2.map.core
Interface OverviewMap

All Known Implementing Classes:
OverviewMap, OverviewMap
public interface OverviewMap

This class displays one or more layers on a Map at a larger extent compared with the Map. You can choose which Map Layers to show in the OverviewMap by using one of the OverviewMap's addLayer methods. These Layers must already be in the Map - if you remove them from the Map, then they are automatically removed from the OverviewMap.

The current extent of the Map is normally shown as a half transparent red colored rectangular frame. You can change the color using the setRectangleFillColor and setRectangleOutlineColor methods.

If you zoom the Map past a certain threshhold, then the OverviewMap will also zoom so that the Map's zoom frame will always fill an area of the OverviewMap that can be readily seen. The threshhold is governed by the ZoomFactor property which is normally set a 4 times, and can be set as low as 2 times. This number represents the relative size of the Map's extent shown on the OverviewMap.

Before you can use an OverviewMap object, you need to call the setMap method to associate it with a Map.

Method Detail

setRectangleFillColor

public void setRectangleFillColor(Color color)
Set the fill color of the viewport rectangle using the given color. A default Alpha transparency value of 80 will be used together with the red,green,blue components of the given colour.

Parameters:
color - the new fill color
See Also:
setRectangleFillColor(java.awt.Color,int)

getRectangleFillColor

public Color getRectangleFillColor()
Get the fill color of the viewport rectangle.

setRectangleFillColor

public void setRectangleFillColor(Color color,
                                  int alpha)
Set the fill color of the viewport rectangle using the given color and transparency. The actual color used will be constructed using the red,green,blue components of the given color, together with the given Alpha transparency. If you want to specify your own transparency, use the other variant of setRectangleFillColor

Parameters:
color - the new fill color
alpha - the new alpha transparency, must be between 0 and 255 inclusive
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if color is null or alpha is out of bounds

setRectangleOutlineColor

public void setRectangleOutlineColor(Color color)
Set the outline color of the viewport rectangle

Parameters:
color - the viewport's outline color

getRectangleOutlineColor

public Color getRectangleOutlineColor()
Get the outline color of the viewport rectangle

setZoomFactor

public void setZoomFactor(double factor)
Sets the zoom factor this overview map. The default zoom factor is four and any value less than 2 is ignored.

Parameters:
factor - the zooming factor

public double getZoomFactor()
Gets the zoom factor this overview map.

addLayer

public void addLayer(Layer layer)
add the specified Layer to the OverviewMap

Parameters:

addLayer

public void addLayer(String layerName)
finds the layer in the Map and adds it if the layer exists in the Map. If not exists, schedules the layer to be added at a later time, if and when the layer is ever added to the Map.

Parameters:
layerName - the name of the layer to be added to the OverviewMap

removeLayer

public boolean removeLayer(Layer layer)
Parameters:
layer - the layer to be removed
Returns:
true == layer existed in the OverviewMap and has been removed, false == otherwise

layerExists

public boolean layerExists(Layer layer)
Check to see if a given layer is added to the overview map or not

Parameters:
layer - the layer to be checked
Returns:
a boolean indicating if the given layer exists or not

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(String layerName)
Get a layer by its name. If it couldn't find one matching the name, a null should be returned

Parameters:
layerName - the given layer name
Returns:
a map layer or null

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(int index)
Get a layer at given index.

Parameters:
index - where a layer should be returned
Returns:
a layer

Get the number of layers added to the overview map

the number of layers
